clues.clue:
Where noble namesake holds court supreme,
'Mid shopping spires and merchant's dream,
The Prince of Wales stands proud and tall—
Seek painted visions on the wall.
There pies take flight on silken wings,
A feast that from the heavens springs,
Where "Parachuting Pies" descend,
And art and appetite transcend.
clues.base_clue: In the shadow of The Prince of Wales, among the grand shopping thoroughfares, discover the painted wonder "Parachuting Pies".

clues.clue: Start at The Prince of Wales pub, positioned as your initial landmark. Head due north (compass bearing 0°) for exactly 16 meters along the street. The artwork "Parachuting Pies" will appear on your right-hand side (east-facing wall). This painted artwork, created in 2013, is displayed on the exterior wall of a multi-storey shopping complex building and features pictorial street art depicting whimsical parachuting pie imagery. Halifax bank serves as your secondary landmark, located precisely 25 meters northeast from the artwork location. The artwork is executed in paint medium and carries the tags: Pictorial, Street Art. Additional nearby reference points include public seating 57m southwest, Clarence Square 101m southeast, Russell Square 143m east-northeast, Church of Scientology of Brighton 158m north-northwest, and Chapel in the Inn 196m due west of the artwork's position on the multi-storey shopping complex.

This striking street art piece is displayed prominently on the exterior wall of an ancient stone or brick structure, likely a historic building with weathered masonry. The artwork combines powerful visual elements across multiple thematic categories: **Animal** imagery featuring wildlife species, **Environmental** motifs highlighting climate and nature themes, **Street Art** styling with urban artistic techniques, and **Symbolic** representations conveying activist messaging.

clues.clue: Start at Rooted & Co coffee shop, a modern independent café with large glass windows and dark wooden exterior cladding located on the street corner. From the main entrance, head directly west (270°) for exactly 8 meters along the pavement, passing the café's outdoor seating area with black metal tables and chairs. After 8 meters, turn your head to the right (north side of the street) where you will find "Birds and Foliage" - a vibrant painted mural created in 2023 using acrylic paint medium, featuring colorful birds perched among lush green foliage and decorative botanical elements. This street art piece combines animal, commercial, pictorial, and street art styles, displayed prominently on the brick wall of a two-story commercial building with white-painted window frames and a red front door. The artwork measures approximately 3 meters wide by 2.5 meters high. As a distance reference landmark, Greggs bakery with its distinctive blue and orange storefront signage is located 21 meters further west from your current position. clues.clue:
Where twilight's sentinel guards the cobbled ways,
Through artistic labyrinths where creativity plays,
Seek the Evening Star's celestial glow—
There watery dreams in pigment flow,
A pond of paint where silence speaks,
And beauty's reflection your treasure seeks.

title: Circus
tags: Animal, Industrial and Local Heritage, Street Art, Symbolic

clues.clue: Where cobbled whispers guide your feet through Brighton's ancient, winding streets, seek the royal pair of old—King and Queen in stories told. There, where time's gentle hand has traced the walls with painted grace, a "Circus" blooms in vibrant hue, a masterpiece awaiting you. Near where Victoria's gardens breathe, this treasure lies for those who seek.
clues.base_clue: Where Ye Olde King & Queen Brighton stands proud, where medieval streets wind through history, the painted artwork "Circus" awaits.
